description:
Azure table storage target implementation for NLog. A fork of harouny's project in github.

The following features set this library apart:

- It supports customizing partition and row keys with macros. For example, you can specify ${longdate}_${guid} in the target "RowKey" property to have your key be made up of a long date/time string and a guid, with an underscore in between. 

- It defers the initialization of the azure storage connection till it is actually needed, thus avoiding any startup errors because you have not initialized your connection string yet.

- It detects connection string changes and re-initializes the azure storage connection accordingly. This is roughly modeled after NLog's own DatabaseTarget implementation.

For more information see the project page at https://github.com/abkonsta/NLog.Extensions.AzureTableStorage">
releaseNotes:
Miscellaneous improvements:

- detect and re-initialize connection string if it is changed from code
- trace statements to help troubleshoot configuration issues
- bug fixes
- new macros
summary: Azure table storage target implementation for NLog which allows to use macros such as ${date}, ${time}, ${ticks} and many others for partition and row keys. Target initialization is deferred so the logging destination can be changed dynamically.
title: NLog.Extensions.AzureTableStorage
